name: Bengali-Style Shorshe Jhol with Crispy Papads
recipeInstructions: In a large pan, heat the mustard oil over medium heat. Add the chopped green chilies and sauté until fragrant.
Add the Bengali-style mustard paste and sauté for about 2-3 minutes, or until it darkens in color.
Add the ghee, chopped onion, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Stir well to combine.
Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer and cook for about 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens slightly.
While the sauce is cooking, fry the Bengali-style papads in hot oil until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Garnish with fresh cilantro leaves and serve the shorshe jhol with crispy papads alongside.
description: Bengali-Style Shorshe Jhol is a spicy, tangy mustard-based soup originating from Bengal. It's a favorite at special occasions in Bengali households. The crispy papads add a delightful crunch to the dish.
